                        <div data-reactid="331">
                         Close enough from bustling and trendy Abbot kenney and Venice beach..we are in a pocket neighborhood. .you drive here because you live here...tranquil and quiet..most of the time..lol..and the main freeways are close by as well as the LA airport..
                        </div>
                        <div data-reactid="332">
                         <li data-reactid="333"><p data-reactid="334">Amazing host and a stunningly beautiful home. I am so grateful I found this slice of paradise near bustling Venice Beach. This home is conveniently located by some of the best dining the beach area has to offer and it is all walking distance. Also not too far away is Abbot Kinney with fine shopping and eye candy alike. In short, I was made to feel at home and welcomed by Sylvain. I had a magnificent time while relaxing and taking a “mini” vacation. Sylvain’s home felt like I was somewhere far- far away yet in reality I was steps away from a vibrant beach culture. Once again, thank you and best wishes on your next project… </p><span data-reactid="335">Angel</span><span data-reactid="336">2015-03-27T00:00:00Z</span></li>
                         <li data-reactid="337"><p data-reactid="338">Great place, wonderful hospitality. Sylvain is a great host, and definitely does his best to make you feel welcome, and at home. The space he has designed (he is an interior designer, and the house is a product of his own work) is tremendous, and has a ton of detail and thought put into it. I found it extremely relaxing and calming, and loved all the light and fresh air that his space offers. He is a collector of many different pieces of art, and it adds to the unique experience. I definitely felt refresh and relaxed after staying here. Hope to be back in his LA crib soon. </p><span data-reactid="339">Neeraj</span><span data-reactid="340">2015-03-07T00:00:00Z</span></li>
                         <li data-reactid="341"><p data-reactid="342">Staying here was the best decision ever! It's a remarkably beautiful place and the hosts are super sweet/welcoming! Will deff be coming back! Thank you </p><span data-reactid="343">Darina </span><span data-reactid="344">2016-07-08T00:00:00Z</span></li>
                         <li data-reactid="345"><p data-reactid="346">I don't think I can quite articulate how truly amazing Sylvain and his home is. The architecture, art, and design are clearly from an award-winning, creative mind. Sylvain has created a profoundly tranquil environment. He's an outstanding host, very warm and kind, and easy to talk to and be around. And his dog and cats just add to the amazing experience you'll have here. I can't recommend this place enough -- while the photos are great, it's even more beautiful in person.</p><span data-reactid="347">Marco</span><span data-reactid="348">2015-03-30T00:00:00Z</span></li>

                     <div aria-hidden="true" class="imageContainer_1xligvk-o_O-legacyImageContainer_1xlpym-o_O-imageContainer_seo_y9ev9r" data-reactid="449">

                         <svg viewbox="0 0 32 32" style="height:32px;width:32px;display:block;" fill="#484848" fill-opacity="0.5" stroke="#ffffff" stroke-width="1.5" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round" data-reactid="456">
                          <path d="M23.993 2.75c-.296 0-.597.017-.898.051-1.14.131-2.288.513-3.408 1.136-1.23.682-2.41 1.621-3.688 2.936-1.28-1.316-2.458-2.254-3.687-2.937-1.12-.622-2.268-1.004-3.41-1.135a7.955 7.955 0 0 0-.896-.051C6.123 2.75.75 4.289.75 11.128c0 7.862 12.238 16.334 14.693 17.952a1.004 1.004 0 0 0 1.113 0c2.454-1.618 14.693-10.09 14.693-17.952 0-6.84-5.374-8.378-7.256-8.378" data-reactid="457"></path>

                      <div class="listingDescription_1woxt0o" data-reactid="458">
                       <div data-reactid="459">
                        <div data-reactid="460">
                         Looking for a high-end, hotel-like experience? You've come to the right listing. This large, modern 1,500 square foot condo underwent a $200k complete remodel in 2014 (first Airbnb review post-remodel is dated March 2015). 
                        </div>
                        <div data-reactid="461">
                         This completely remodeled unit features floor-to-ceiling windows, custom teak cabinetry, marble bathrooms, designer furniture, and amazing treetop views with the Santa Monica Mountains as a backdrop. Lighting and motorized shades are controlled by a home automation system that makes changing the mood as easy as pressing a button. The oversized living room features a 70" LCD 3D TV with theater sound, a PS3, Nintendo WII, and Apple TV. All A/V equipment is hidden away in a dedicated closet. The master bedroom has a California King bed with latex mattress. The second bedroom can transform into an office via a custom queen sized murphy bed (with real mattress) which disappears into a beautiful teak paneled wall in seconds. The master bath features an in-ceiling rainfall shower, while the guest bath has a rainfall shower/tub combo. The kitchen is equipped with built-in Miele and Gaggenau appliances including a Miele coffee machine, which makes fresh ground espresso, coffee, cappuccinos and more with the press of a button. A laundry room is adjacent to the unit. Weekly maid service is provided and includes laundering of sheets and towels. Perfect for those looking for short term, luxury, hotel-style accommodations. The iconic Marina City Club is a resort-like community which features outdoor pools, a full service fitness center, café, restaurant, dry cleaners, car wash, plenty of guest parking, and more. ÜberX is a $10 fare and 10-minute ride from LAX. It doesn’t get much more convenient than this. Due to condo association restrictions, the minimum rental period is 30 days. 
                        </div>
                        <div data-reactid="462">
                         "The Marina," as Marina Del Rey is often referred to by locals, is located just south of Venice. It's close to the action yet removed enough for peace and quiet. The apartment is exactly one mile from the portion of Abbott Kinney Street which GQ named the "coolest block in America." With famed restaurants, food trucks, eclectic shops, art galleries, and a few hip watering holes, there's plenty to keep you entertained. Approximately three miles north of the condo is downtown Santa Monica with its own unique vibe and set of options. 
                        </div>
                        <div data-reactid="463">

                      <div class="wishlistHeartContainer_1ibcqbg" data-reactid="582">
                       <label for="wishlist-listing15999154" class="container_1figzu9" style="height:32px;width:32px;" data-reactid="583"><input type="checkbox" id="wishlist-listing15999154" class="input_1m8bb6v-o_O-fastclickHack_1dwq0yf" data-reactid="584"><span class="accessible_1m8bb6v" data-reactid="585"><span data-reactid="586">Save to Wish List</span></span>

                         <svg viewbox="0 0 32 32" style="height:32px;width:32px;display:block;" fill="#484848" fill-opacity="0.5" stroke="#ffffff" stroke-width="1.5" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round" data-reactid="588">
                          <path d="M23.993 2.75c-.296 0-.597.017-.898.051-1.14.131-2.288.513-3.408 1.136-1.23.682-2.41 1.621-3.688 2.936-1.28-1.316-2.458-2.254-3.687-2.937-1.12-.622-2.268-1.004-3.41-1.135a7.955 7.955 0 0 0-.896-.051C6.123 2.75.75 4.289.75 11.128c0 7.862 12.238 16.334 14.693 17.952a1.004 1.004 0 0 0 1.113 0c2.454-1.618 14.693-10.09 14.693-17.952 0-6.84-5.374-8.378-7.256-8.378" data-reactid="589"></path>

                      <div class="listingDescription_1woxt0o" data-reactid="590">
                       <div data-reactid="591">
                        <div data-reactid="592">
                         Enjoy staying in a quiet neighborhood with tons of nearby local attractions at our beach cottage one-bedroom. This is the upper apartment in a 2 unit home with a private back yard that’s great for outdoor dining and soaking up the sun! You won’t find many places like this around Venice. You’ll be 1 block to the sand, 1 block to restaurants/bars/coffee, &amp; 1 block to the Venice Canals. Walkable area &amp; PARKING INCLUDED! Ideal for couples, groups, weekend getaways, solo travelers, or business trips.
                        </div>
                        <div data-reactid="593">
                         This spacious and sunny 1-bedroom/1-bathroom apartment is located on a quiet street that’s one of the best-kept secrets of Venice Beach— a calm and quiet beach area. You’ll be immersed in a real neighborhood of friendly beach lovers and steps away from famous and fun attractions. The space is the upper unit in a 2-story house with a large and private fenced back yard that includes outdoor seating, a large outdoor sectional couch, and a grill. It’s a great spot for a BBQ, to enjoy the sun, read a book, relax, and even get work done if needed. Backyards this size are a rarity so close to the beach in Venice—this spot is a unique gem. This unit includes a living room with a large fold-out couch, chairs, a work station/dining table, and 40” smart-TV (cable with over 200 channels included). The kitchen space is fully-loaded with all of the cookware/glasses/dishes, etc. that you’d need to make a meal and includes a large refrigerator, stove, sink, and toaster oven. There's also a breakfast nook that overlooks the Venice Canals. The bedroom has a luxurious king-size bed and connects to a full bathroom with a shower/tub as well as a large walk-in closet. Cable TV and strong wifi are connected both upstairs and downstairs and the signal is great outside! This cottage is situated in one of the most unique and walkable areas in Los Angeles! You will enjoy bicycle and walking paths along the oceanfront with the best people-watching in the area. Stay active with the world-famous Muscle Beach, beach volleyball courts, and surfing in your own backyard. Within walking distance are health spas and yoga studios. Dine at one of the many restaurants just around the corner on Washington Blvd. or enjoy the sunset at one of the rooftop bars. You can even walk to the fabulous Abbott Kinney—just declared the coolest block in America by GQ magazine. You can walk to the many beautiful boats in the marina, and you can also walk to the Venice Boardwalk—a fun and eclectic slice of local art and culture! Santa Monica is also very close and it’s about a 30-40 minute ocean-side walk to the famous Santa Monica Pier. But best of all, after all that walking and beach fun, you will come home to a comfy apartment with all the amenities of home! If for some reason you have a bit of work to do, there is a well lit desk with plenty of space for a laptop and printer in the living room, as well as a desk in the bedroom. We offer FREE on site outdoor parking for the first car and guests can rent an additional space for $20 a night. It's perfect for families, groups of friends, or business travelers. We can accommodate up to 8 people (4 downstairs and 4 upstairs). The location is within a 15-minute drive from LAX and costs around $24 plus tip via Taix and often less with Uber/LYFT. You can also use Prime Time Shuttle for a shared ride. Dogs considered for an additional fee of $100; generally we do not allow cats. Additional Amenities: Smart 40” Flat-screen TV with Cable High Speed Internet &amp; Wi-Fi Full Kitchen &amp; Appliances (toaster oven, coffee maker, etc.) Walk-In Closet Shower in Both Bathrooms Washer/Dryer on Premises Large Backyard with Seating and BBQ Family/Kid Friendly
                        </div>
                        <div data-reactid="594">
                         Our neighborhood is right on the boarder of Venice Beach and Marina Del Rey, just south of the Venice Pier. It’s a quiet location in a friendly beach community. A walkers paradise, you’ll be steps away from many great restaurants, coffee shops, bars, and activities. There are several great local markets off Washington Blvd. where you can walk to and get groceries, too. You are a few minute walk away from the expansive white sand beaches of Venice and Marina Del Rey Beach, where you can spend the day enjoying the sand and sun and experiencing the shopping and people watching. To the left of the Venice Pier is what neighbors call, "secret beach", a huge stretch of the quiet, powder sand beach of Marina Del Rey's Peninsula. Sit in the sun or walk north of the Venice Pier and you will come upon the famous Venice Beach Boardwalk with shops, artists, street performers, beach bars, beach restaurants and of course, more beach. Continue on your walk or bike ride and you next reach Santa Monica, then Malibu. All easily explored on bike. You can also take a relaxing stroll or bike ride along the Venice Grand Canal-- just steps from our building-- and continue to the quiet smaller canals by Dell Street. You will think you are in Venice Italy. DO NOT MISS. Another can’t miss that’s within walking distance is Abbot Kinney Blvd—a trendy block of restaurants, shops, and bars that was recently named “the coolest street in America” by GQ magazine. There’s a farmers marker there every Saturday, several local clothing companies with unique California style, the TOMS Shoes flagship store and coffee shop, several organic/vegan/vegetarian eateries, and many fine wine establishments. Santa Monica is just a 5 minute drive from the apartment, and keep going north and you hit Malibu in under 20 minutes. TOP "MUST SEE" --The Venice Murals &amp; "Art Walls" --The Venice Canals &amp; homes along the canals. --The view of Los Angeles from the "High Lounge" --Architecture --Victorian to contemporary. --Art galleries, shops, cafes, restaurants along the Boardwalk, Abbot Kinney Blvd. and Main Street. ACTIVITIES in VENICE: Sailing, para-sailing, kite flying, paddle tennis, hiking, and bicycling with beautiful ocean &amp; mountain views along the way. Bicycle, surfboard, &amp; roller skate or roller blade rentals MORE THINGS TO DO: The famous outdoor MUSCLE BEACH GYM Volley ball courts on the sand. Skateboard Park Roller Skating &amp;/ Roller Blading Park Surfing Santa Monica Pier Hiking in Malibu and Santa Monica Bike Path: 35 miles of bike path from Malibu to Hermosa Beach The Getty Museum &amp; the Getty Villa (wonderful views)
                        </div>

                      <div class="listingDescription_1woxt0o" data-reactid="721">
                       <div data-reactid="722">
                        <div data-reactid="723">
                         1 block to the beach, steps from Venice Pier, shops/bars/restaurants and more! Nestled between Venice &amp; Marina Del Rey on the lovely Catamaran walkway, an unbeatable location with parking. Enjoy a quiet space in unique Venice &amp; Marina Del Rey
                        </div>
                        <div data-reactid="724">
                         Welcome to the beach! We are located at the border of Venice and Marina Del Rey, on a quiet, nostalgic, beachside block, just a short walk to the ocean. Location is unbeatable, and includes a parking space! House is nestled on a sunny side street close to all the action but far enough to have a quiet stay. Apartment features: - Wifi included. -King bed -Pull out futon -Flatscreen HD/TV with all cable channels. -Dining room table comfortably seats 4 and is surrounded by west-facing windows with great sunsets! -Extra counter space/work space at our kitchen bar with 2 stools. -Plenty of closet space with hangers - *Note* We use a hot plate, not a stove. Property features: - Parking space included. - 2nd floor apartment. - We have bikes available for rent, $15/day! Neighborhood features - Short 2 minute walk to the beach. - 2 blocks walk to Washington Square w/ restaurants, shops, bike rental, shopping, yoga. - 2 blocks walk to Venice canal pathway.
                        </div>
                        <div data-reactid="725">
                         All the neighbors know each other and are cool and friendly surfers and beach-goers! I can't say enough about how I enjoy this community... it's really wonderful to be able to walk to the restaurants and shops or walk to the beach with a surfboard in a city as big as Los Angeles, and see and say hi to my neighbors out in their gardens, walking their dogs, or getting a cup of coffee at The Cow's End around the corner... I wouldn't want to spend days off anywhere else. This is truly an authentic way to experience Venice, from the view of a local.
                        </div>
                        <div data-reactid="726">
                         <li data-reactid="727"><p data-reactid="728">Wayne and Abby's location was amazing and checking in and out was easy - though we never met Abby in person. It was just steps to the beach and minutes to the heart of the Venice strip. There are plenty of great places to eat and drink in walking distance. The apartment itself was ok - but nothing special. It was functional as a place to sleep since we spent our days exploring. The listing says it can accommodate up to 4 guests but I wouldn't recommend more than two, if you want to be comfortable. The kitchen and bathroom were very small, and some of the kitchen materials such as dishes and appliances were not clean. Additionally the oven seemed to be broken and we texted on our first night to inquire about how to use it, but never received a response... This was a bit frustrating as we had purchased groceries and planned to cook most of our meals. The lack of response was especially frustrating because Abby was quick to reply to all other messages. Another downside, is that the neighbors were quite loud some nights and kept us up with loud music twice. Overall our stay was enjoyable and the location was prime, but we did feel that we overpaid for the experience we had. </p><span data-reactid="729">Aleena</span><span data-reactid="730">2016-02-21T00:00:00Z</span></li>
                         <li data-reactid="731"><p data-reactid="732">Clean and cozy, great location, and fully stocked kitchen was very convenient. The included parking made getting around hassle free. Couple of minor areas for improvement. Bathroom sink was clogged and curtain pieces fell out when opening the blinds. WiFi signal was spotty. </p><span data-reactid="733">Nitin</span><span data-reactid="734">2016-03-23T00:00:00Z</span></li>
                         <li data-reactid="735"><p data-reactid="736">What a wonderful place. A block from the beach in a great location. Walk to the Venice canals, muscle beach, Abbot Kinney Road, Santa Monica. Intend to stay again and highly recommend this rental. Wayne and Abby provided everything we needed.</p><span data-reactid="737">Michael</span><span data-reactid="738">2017-01-30T00:00:00Z</span></li>
                         <li data-reactid="739"><p data-reactid="740">As described! We had a lovely time in this cozy home by the beach and the Venice Pier!</p><span data-reactid="741">Brandon</span><span data-reactid="742">2016-01-02T00:00:00Z</span></li>
                         <li data-reactid="743"><p data-reactid="744">Great place to stay during our visit. The apartment is optimally located just steps from the beach. Also, the apartment is equipped with everything you would need for a comfortable stay. We would definitely visit again. </p><span data-reactid="745">LaBradford</span><span data-reactid="746">2016-04-05T00:00:00Z</span></li>
                         <li data-reactid="747"><p data-reactid="748">Great location, nice clean apartment. We were very happy with our stay. Easy walk to the beach. Beach chairs and boogie boards are very convenient. It will be our first choice in any future trips to the area.</p><span data-reactid="749">Kamlesh</span><span data-reactid="750">2015-11-02T00:00:00Z</span></li>
                         <li data-reactid="751"><p data-reactid="752">We had an amazing 12 night stay at Wayne's condo. Check in was a breeze and he was always a text or phone call away if we needed anything. The condo was appointed as listed with plenty of lounge space and sleeping space for a family of 4. The best thing about our stay was that it was "literally" one block away from the beach and maybe two blocks from the Venice Board Walk and fishing pier. Plenty of things to do and places to eat. I can't even count the number of times we walked to the village to get ice cream for the kids. Amazing time and memories. Would highly recommend. -Hannibal &amp; KC</p><span data-reactid="753">Hannibal</span><span data-reactid="754">2015-10-17T00:00:00Z</span></li>
                         <li data-reactid="755"><p data-reactid="756">This was my first airbnb experience and it was perfect!! The apartment is as shown. It was clean, well equipped and very comfortable. Location can't be beat! You can easily walk to the beach, restaurants, cafes, the canals and the Venice beach Boardwalk. The parking spot is very convenient as well. Wayne was great to deal with. He was accommodating of any requests and replied to messages promptly. I wouldn't hesitate to return!! Thanks Wayne! </p><span data-reactid="757">Rita</span><span data-reactid="758">2015-10-01T00:00:00Z</span></li>
                        </div>

                        </div>
                        <div data-reactid="859">
                         Located just blocks away from the Venice pier, our apartment will provide you the perfect Los Angeles trip! Walk along the Venice Beach boardwalk and soak up the famous California sunshine. Lay out on the sand among the palm trees and feel the swaying Pacific Ocean breeze. Act like a local and rent a beach cruiser and bike around the streets and view all the different houses in the neighborhoods of Venice. Stop down Abbot Kinney where there are tons of shops, restaurants, and bars. Our 1 bedroom apartment is comfortably furnished with clean, modern accents, and open floor plan. Whip up a meal in the kitchen with stainless steel appliances and dine on the patio with views of the neighborhood. Lounge about the couch that can convert to additional bedding or head out to see all Los Angeles has to offer. Bedding: Bedroom 1- Master bedroom: King Bed Additional bedding available: Full Sofa Bed Sleeps: 4 Our home is fully furnished and very comfortable. The kitchen is stocked with everything you'll need: appliances, cookware, dishes, etc. Our home is professionally cleaned before every stay, and comes with clean linens, towels, soaps, and everything else you'll need for a comfortable stay.
                        </div>

                       <div data-reactid="972">
                        <div data-reactid="973">
                         Brand new Venice Beach Studio Apartment. 5 blocks to the beach, walking distance to the famed Venice Beach Canals, and 5 minutes to Abbot Kinney. Street Parking.
                        </div>
                        <!-- react-text: 974 -->
                        <!-- /react-text -->
                        <div data-reactid="975">
                         Located just 6 miles from LAX. There is a bus stop that takes you to the airport. Also, a quick cab or Uber ride. *PLACES I LIKE TO HAUNT: For Coffee: Joni's Coffee Roasting Cafe (Across the street) *Sushi: Kifune (good sushi - a little pricey) One block away My favorite breakfast place: Killer Cafe 4213 Admiralty Way (Right on the water). Try the Killer Shrimp Breakfast Burrito "Killer Shrimp in a Large Flour Tortilla filled with Scrambled Eggs, Cheddar Cheese and Avocado served with your choice of Hash Browns or Home Fries"! It is Great! This restaurant is right next door to Killer Shrimp, which is fun, too. More Breakfast: Cows End The French Market Cafe, Maxwell's, Gjusta (Gjelina's new breakfast/lunch place) Superba on Lincoln 3 square on Abbott Kinney Favorite Dinner Spot: Gjelina Open 8am - Midnight- it is awesome - reservations a must 1429 Abbot Kinney Blvd OR Salt Air 1616 Abbott Kinney Bohemian vibe, refined yet eclectic bistro fare focuses on fresh seafood LUNCH or DINNER: The French Market Cafe Tajrish Persian (in mini mall on Wash good as takeaway) In n Out Burger (near Costco) 26 Beach St (burgers) Bahn Mi on Lincoln/Rose for Vietnamese sandwiches Cafe Gratitude on Rose Seed (vegan) on Windward Circle HAPPY HOUR Beachside at the Jamaica Bay Inn 14160 Palawan Way, Marina del Rey 90292 JUICES &amp; SMOOTHIES: Moon Juice on Rose HEALTHY EATS: Kreation on Abbott Kinney Windward Farms on Windward Circle (mkt) James Beach on Venice @ the beach (good fish tacos) Barnyard, Mao's Kitchen (Chinese) Hosteria del Piccolo Rose Ave Via Veneto ($) Main St Chaya Venice sushi and more! The Anchor on Main PIZZA: Abbots Pizza Stella Barra (Main St) The South End SUSHI: Sugarfish (in mall Lincoln/Mindanao) Hama Sushi Kifune Other fun spots: Islands, Scopa, C &amp; O Trattoria, Hinanos, Canal Club, Mercedes, BIKE RENTALS: 5 blocks away Venice Bike &amp; Skates 21 Washington Blvd Venice, CA 90292 Phone numb(PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) OR Venice Beach Rental: 5 blocks away 3100 Ocean Front Walk Venice, CA 90292 Phone numb(PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) Venice Skate Park (1 mile away) Oceanfront skate park featuring a sunken pool &amp; a street-inspired area with stairs, ledges &amp; rails. Marina Del Rey is walking distance. Fisherman's Village offers a view of Marina del Rey's dominant feature, the Marina, the world's largest man-made small craft harbor with 19 marinas with capacity for 5,300 boats and is home port to approximately 6,500 boats. It is bordered on three sides by the city of Los Angeles – Pacific Palisades on the northwest, Brentwood on the north, West Los Angeles on the northeast, Mar Vista on the east, and Venice on the southeast. Santa Monica is 3 miles away. Santa Monica has three main shopping districts, Montana Avenue on the north side of the city, the Downtown District in the city's core, and Main Street on the south end of the city. Each of these districts has its own unique feel and personality. Montana Avenue is a stretch of luxury boutique stores, restaurants, and small offices that generally features more upscale shopping. The Main Street district offers an eclectic mix of clothing, restaurants, and other specialty retail. The Downtown District is the home of the Third Street Promenade, a major outdoor pedestrian-only shopping district that stretches for three blocks between Wilshire Blvd. and Broadway. Santa Monica Place, the indoor mall designed by Frank Gehry, is located at the south end of the Promenade. Palisades Park stretches out along the crumbling bluffs overlooking the Pacific and is a favorite walking area to view the ocean. Santa Monica is home to many Hollywood celebrities and executives and is a mixture of affluent single-family neighborhoods, renters, surfers, professionals, and students. Playa Vista is 3 miles away. Playa Vista is adjoined on the northwest by Del Rey, on the north and east by Culver City, on the southeast by Westchester and on the west by Marina Del Rey. Culver City is 4 miles away. Since the 1920s, Culver City has been a significant center for motion picture and later television production, in part because it was the home of MGM Studios. It was also the headquarters for the Hughes Aircraft Company from (phone number hidden). National Public Radio West and Sony Pictures Entertainment now have headquarters in the city. The NFL Network studio is also based in Culver City. Beverly Hills is 9 miles away. Playground to the rich and famous, Beverly Hills is the home of some of California's most opulent homes, hotels and personalities. Visitors flock to 90210 to experience the allure of Hollywood, world-class shopping, fine dining and of course star-gazing. Give your credit card a real workout at top end boutiques and department stores on Rodeo Drive and Wilshire Boulevard, or dine in famous celebrity hangouts and watch for your favorite stars. The Getty Museum is 11 miles away, and is an art museum in California housed on two campuses: the Getty Center and Getty Villa. The Getty Center is in the Brentwood neighborhood and is the primary location of the Museum. The collection features Western art from the Middle Ages to the present. The Museum's second location, the Getty Villa, is in the Pacific Palisades neighborhood and displays art from "ancient Greece, Rome, and Etruria". The Getty Malibu is 8 miles away. Hermosa Beach is 12 miles away. Hermosa Beach pier is at the end of Pier Avenue, which is one of the beach community's main shopping, eating and partying areas. Manhattan Beach is 10 miles away. Manhattan Beach is a hotspot for beach volleyball and surfing. Every August, the city hosts the Manhattan Beach Open Volleyball tournament and the International Surf Festival. Manhattan Beach has attracted professional athletes and actors to take up residence there since the 1990s. Long Beach is 27 miles away. Long Beach is where the action begins and the fun never ends. From the regal Queen Mary and spectacular Aquarium of the Pacific to stirring Broadway shows, live music venues and hundreds of exclusive dining destinations--all centrally located. Airport-close, a brief and pleasant cruise away from Catalina Island. The city is a dominant maritime center of the United States. The Port of Long Beach is the United States' second busiest container port and one of the world's largest shipping ports. Catalina Island is a boat ride away and 22 miles across the sea. Catalina Island features fabulous land and water activities - including the new Zip Line and SeaTrek Undersea Adventure, romantic lodging for every taste and budget, a diversity of dining experiences, and extraordinary venues for weddings and group events. Staples Center is 15 miles away. Staples Center is a large multi-purpose sports arena in Downtown Los Angeles. Adjacent to the L.A. Live development, it is located next to the Los Angeles Convention Center complex along Figueroa Street. Opening on Octob(PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN), it is one of the major sporting facilities in the Greater Los Angeles Area. The arena is home to the Los Angeles Lakers and the Los Angeles Clippers of the National Basketball Association (NBA), the Los Angeles Kings of the National Hockey League (NHL), and the Los Angeles Sparks of the Women's National Basketball Association (WNBA). The Los Angeles Avengers of the Arena Football League (AFL) and the Los Angeles D-Fenders of the NBA D-League were also tenants until both franchises were discontinued; the D-Fenders moved to the Lakers' practice facility at the Toyota Sports Center in El Segundo, California for the 2011–12 season. Staples Center is also host to over 250 events and nearly (phone number hidden) guests a year. It is the only arena in the NBA shared by two teams. It is a 11 mile drive to La Brea Tar Pits. The La Brea Tar Pits (or Rancho La Brea Tar Pits) are a group of tar pits around which Hancock Park was formed, in urban Los Angeles. Natural asphalt (also called asphaltum, bitumen, pitch or tar - brea in Spanish) has seeped up from the ground in this area for tens of thousands of years. The tar is often covered with dust, leaves, or water. Over many centuries, the bones of animals that were trapped in the tar were preserved. The George C. Page Museum is dedicated to researching the tar pits and displaying specimens from the animals that died there. The La Brea Tar Pits are a registered National Natural Landmark. The California Science Center is 12 miles away and houses the Space Shuttle Endeavor. Hollywood is 12 miles away. It is prominent for its place as the home of the entertainment industry, including several of its historic studios. Its name has come to represent the motion picture industry of the United States. Street limits of the Hollywood neighborhood are: north, Hollywood Boulevard from La Brea Avenue to the east boundary of Wattles Garden Park and Franklin Avenue between Bonita and Western avenues; east, Western Avenue; south, Melrose Avenue, and west, La Brea Avenue or the West Hollywood city line. Also, Hollywood is home to the famous Anaheim, the home to TCL Chinese Theatre is a cinema on the historic Hollywood Walk of Fame at 6925 Hollywood Boulevard in Hollywood, California. Originally Grauman's Chinese Theatre. It is 15 miles to Sherman Oaks. Sherman Oaks is a neighborhood in the San Fernando Valley. A number of celebrities live in Sherman Oaks. There is many shops, restaurants and movie theaters along the main street Ventura Blvd. Studio City is 19 miles away. Studio City is a historic neighborhood within the city of Los Angeles, California, in the San Fernando Valley, known for the number of celebrities who have been seen or who reside there. Studio City is bordered on the north by Valley Village, on the east by Toluca Lake and Universal City, on the south by Hollywood Hills West, on the southwest by Beverly Crest and on the west by Sherman Oaks. Griffith Observatory is a 20 mile drive. Griffith Observatory is a facility sitting on the south-facing slope of Mount Hollywood in Los Angeles' Griffith Park. It commands a view of the Los Angeles Basin, including Downtown Los Angeles to the southeast, Hollywood to the south, and the Pacific Ocean to the southwest. The observatory is a popular tourist attraction with an extensive array of space and science-related displays. Palos Verdes is 22 miles away. Palos Verdes is home to Terranea Resort, which offers spectacular views of the Pacific. Terrenea is a great place to grab a cocktail at sunset or have a casual dinner outside at Nelson’s. Anaheim, the home of Disneyland and Downtown Disney, is 40 miles away. Downtown Disney (officially the Downtown Disney District) is an outdoor shopping, dining, and entertainment area, also known as a "shoppertainment center", located at the Disneyland Resort in Anaheim, California, United States. It was constructed during the Disneyland Resort expansion which also included the construction of Disney California Adventure, and opened on January 12, 2001. The Nixon Presidential Library is 49 miles away. The Richard Nixon Presidential Library and Museum is the presidential library and final resting place of Richard Milhous Nixon, the 37th President of the United States. Located in Yorba Linda, California, the library is one of thirteen administered by the National Archives and Records Administration. From its original dedication in 1990 until becoming a federal facility on July 11, 2007, the library and museum was operated by the private Richard Nixon Foundation and was known as the Richard Nixon Library &amp; Birthplace. The 9-acre (3.6 ha) campus is located at 18001 Yorba Linda Boulevard in Yorba Linda, California and incorporates the National Historic Landmarked Richard Nixon Birthplace where Nixon was born in 1913 and spent his childhood. The facility is now jointly operated by NARA and the Richard Nixon Foundation. The Reagan Presidential Library is 45 miles away. The Ronald Reagan Presidential Library and Center for Public Affairs is the presidential library and final resting place of Ronald Wilson Reagan, the 40th President of the United States. Designed by Hugh Stubbins and Associates, the library is located in Simi Valley. The library may be accessed by driving to the Olsen Road exit of State Route 23, which connects to the nearby Ronald Reagan Freeway, State Route 118. The Reagan Library is the largest of the thirteen federally operated presidential libraries. The street address, 40 Presidential Drive, is numbered in honor of Reagan's place as the 40th President. The Reagan Library is open daily from 10am - 5pm, with the exception of a few holidays (Thanksgiving Day, Christmas Day and New Year's Day). Parking is free, as is access to the grounds surrounding the library, but there is an admission fee for entry into the library and special exhibits. Ojai is a beautiful community 81 miles north. The town is known mostly for its hotels and services catering to tourism, recreation including strong hiking, and spiritual retreats, as well as for a strong farmers' market on Sundays and an abundance of local organic agriculture. It also has an abundance of small businesses specializing in local and ecologically friendly art, design, and home improvement—such as galleries and a solar power company—as chain stores (other than a few gas stations) are forbidden by Ojai city law to encourage local small business development and keep the town unique. The city's self-styled nickname is "The Shangri-La of Southern California", referring to the similarities between the health-and-spirituality-focused region and the mystical sanctuary of James Hilton's novel Lost Horizon. Santa Barbara is 94 miles away. Santa Barbara's climate is often described as Mediterranean, and the city has been promoted as the "American Riviera". The San Diego Zoo Safari Park is 120 miles away. The San Diego Zoo Safari Park, known as the San Diego Wild Animal Park until 2010, is an 1,800 acre zoo in the San Pasqual Valley area of San Diego, California, near Escondido. It is one of the largest tourist attractions in San Diego County LEGOLAND is 102 miles away. LEGOLAND California Resort features more than 60 rides, shows and attraction. San Diego is 130 miles away. Tourism is a major industry owing to the city's climate, its beaches, and numerous tourist attractions such as Balboa Park, Belmont amusement park, San Diego Zoo, San Diego Zoo Safari Park, and SeaWorld San Diego. San Diego's Spanish and Mexican heritage is reflected in the many historic sites across the city, such as Mission San Diego de Alcala and Old Town San Diego State Historic Park. Annual events in San Diego include Comic-Con, the Farmers Insurance Open golf tournament, San Diego Pride, the San Diego Black Film Festival, and Street Scene Music Festival. Also, the local craft brewing industry attracts an increasing number of visitors for "beer tours" and the annual San Diego Beer Week in November; San Diego has been called "America's Craft Beer Capital."
                        </div>

                       <div data-reactid="1108">
                        <div data-reactid="1109">
                         Steps from the sand, this cozy bachelor apartment is in a triplex on a quiet upscale street in the Marina Peninsula. Open up your sliding doors and listen to the waves crash as you sleep on a brand new mattress with soft organic bedding. Flatscreen/4k Smart TV with cable and wifi. Kitchenette with mini fridge and freezer, toaster oven and coffee maker. One parking space included.
                        </div>
                        <div data-reactid="1110">
                         Far enough from all the noise and action to feel safe and enjoy the quiet, yet still walking distance to all of the great activities. A few steps away from the Pacific Ocean, and close to Washington Square, Abbott Kinney, Venice Beach Boardwalk, Santa Monica, Marina Harbor, the Venice Canals and LAX. You’ll love this space because of the ambiance and the neighborhood. It's an amazing place for couples, solo adventurers, and business travelers.

                       <div data-reactid="1215">
                        <div data-reactid="1216">
                         Have your own home and yard in Venice Beach. Most studios or guest houses in Venice Beach offer little to no outdoors to enjoy. The cozy house is a short walk to Abbot Kinney and the famous Gjlena restaurant, boutique shopping and people watching. Stroll thru the famous Venice canals just a 15 minute walk. Washington will lead you to the beach with a 5 minute drive or 20 minute walk. The home is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers, families, and furry friends.
                        </div>
                        <div data-reactid="1217">
                         Enjoy the Boho Chic decor. Desk and high speed WIFI for those who need to work. Back yard to sit under the lemon tree and read a book or recline in the hammock. 135 channel analog HDTV. Full size kitchen for all cooking needs. There are 2 beds and 1 bedroom. The 2nd bed is a cute firm daybed in the living room as seen in the photos. Dimensions approximately 30x68in. More suited for a small person. There is a sofa for a fourth if necessary.
                        </div>
                        <div data-reactid="1218">
                         Ive listed on this website about 50 different places, restaurants, hikes and other things to do. These are all my favorites! (URL HIDDEN)
                        </div>

                        <div data-reactid="1478">
                         My place is on the Beach, Venice Fishing Pier. You’ll love my place because of the neighborhood. My place is good for couples, solo adventurers, business travelers and families or groups of 4, or 5 if someone wants to sleep on the sofa.

                         It is on the beach and has a view of the ocean from all of the public spaces.

                       <div data-reactid="1605">
                        <div data-reactid="1606">
                         Our beautiful apartment offers you a private bedroom in a very large shared living space and a parking garage. All ideally located 5 miles from LAX ! (Avoid traffic) We also have a laundry room in the building. A gracious hostess will be happy to share her knowledge of great sites.
                        </div>
                        <div data-reactid="1607">
                         We are located on the top floor, so our living area is larger and quiet. You have a large Private bedroom that has up to three (real) beds and has a view of the marina.
                        </div>
                        <div data-reactid="1608">
                         Love that we are on the water, in the marina. If you love boats, this is heaven! Also, within the immediate vicinity, is a Carlton Ritz and Marriott hotels, so we are situated in a nice area of town, (yet not charging anywhere's near the price of these two hotels. ;) ) Until Labor Day, Thursday through Sunday we have a Water Bus going around the marina, and can bring you to some lovely restaurants or some local events, such as music performances. Within short walking distance on the boardwalk/bikepath are some fantastic restaurants. In fact, we're next door to a fabulous restaurant open 24 hours. Ideal for foreign travelers with jetlagged, or have a flight scheduled at complicated hours. Short distance to LAX (less than 6 miles), and if you know LA, traffic is dreadful, so being this close allows you to get the maximum time out of your vacation before facing the lines at LAX. Near grocery stores (one of them is open 24 hours), movie theaters and so much more at less than a 5 minute drive or 15-20 minute walk.
                        </div>

                   <meta itemprop="name" content="Venice Beach Cottage Loft w/ Private Backyard - Apartment - Marina del Rey" data-reactid="1721">

                    <div id="listing-15998351" class="listingContainer_f21qs6" data-reactid="1725">
                     <div aria-hidden="true" class="imageContainer_1xligvk-o_O-legacyImageContainer_1xlpym-o_O-imageContainer_seo_y9ev9r" data-reactid="1726">
                      <div class="wishlistHeartContainer_1ibcqbg" data-reactid="1727">
                       <label for="wishlist-listing15998351" class="container_1figzu9" style="height:32px;width:32px;" data-reactid="1728"><input type="checkbox" id="wishlist-listing15998351" class="input_1m8bb6v-o_O-fastclickHack_1dwq0yf" data-reactid="1729"><span class="accessible_1m8bb6v" data-reactid="1730"><span data-reactid="1731">Save to Wish List</span></span>
                        <div class="icon_a755yf-o_O-fastclickHack_1dwq0yf" data-reactid="1732">
                         <svg viewbox="0 0 32 32" style="height:32px;width:32px;display:block;" fill="#484848" fill-opacity="0.5" stroke="#ffffff" stroke-width="1.5" stroke-linecap="round" stroke-linejoin="round" data-reactid="1733">
                          <path d="M23.993 2.75c-.296 0-.597.017-.898.051-1.14.131-2.288.513-3.408 1.136-1.23.682-2.41 1.621-3.688 2.936-1.28-1.316-2.458-2.254-3.687-2.937-1.12-.622-2.268-1.004-3.41-1.135a7.955 7.955 0 0 0-.896-.051C6.123 2.75.75 4.289.75 11.128c0 7.862 12.238 16.334 14.693 17.952a1.004 1.004 0 0 0 1.113 0c2.454-1.618 14.693-10.09 14.693-17.952 0-6.84-5.374-8.378-7.256-8.378" data-reactid="1734"></path>

                      <div class="listingDescription_1woxt0o" data-reactid="1735">
                       <div data-reactid="1736">
                        <div data-reactid="1737">
                         Enjoy staying in a quiet neighborhood with tons of nearby local attractions at our beach cottage loft. This is the bottom apartment in a 2 unit home with a private back yard that’s great for outdoor dining and soaking up the sun! You won’t find many places like this around Venice. You’ll be 1 block to the sand, 1 block to restaurants/bars/coffee, &amp; 1 block to the Venice Canals. Walkable area &amp; PARKING INCLUDED! Ideal for couples, solo travelers, weekend getaways, or business trips.
                        </div>
                        <div data-reactid="1738">
                         This downstairs loft unit is located on a quiet street that’s one of the best-kept secrets of Venice Beach— a calm and quiet beach area. You’ll be immersed in a real neighborhood of friendly beach lovers and steps away from famous and fun attractions. The space is the bottom unit of a 2-story house with a large and private fenced back yard that includes outdoor seating, a large outdoor sectional couch, and a grill. You'll have full access to this and share it with any guests who are staying upstairs. It’s a great spot for a BBQ, to enjoy the sun, read a book, relax, and even get work done if needed. Backyards this size are a rarity so close to the beach in Venice—this spot is a unique gem. The trendy loft-style apartment has a queen-size bed, fold out couch, seating area, 40” smart-TV, and its own set of dishes/glassware. We also have a mini fridge, toaster oven, and coffee pot. There’s a connecting full bathroom with a shower and wardrobe closet. The downstairs area has its own private entrance and locked door. Cable TV and strong wifi are included and the signal is great outside! This cottage is situated in one of the most unique and walkable areas in Los Angeles! You will enjoy bicycle and walking paths along the oceanfront with the best people-watching in the area. Stay active with the world-famous Muscle Beach, beach volleyball courts, and surfing in your own backyard. Within walking distance are health spas and yoga studios. Dine at one of the many restaurants just around the corner on Washington Blvd. or enjoy the sunset at one of the rooftop bars. You can even walk to the fabulous Abbott Kinney—just declared the coolest block in America by GQ magazine. You can walk to the many beautiful boats in the marina, and you can also walk to the Venice Boardwalk—a fun and eclectic slice of local art and culture! Santa Monica is also very close and it’s about a 30-40 minute ocean-side walk to the famous Santa Monica Pier. But best of all, after all that walking and beach fun, you will come home to a comfy apartment with all the amenities of home! We offer FREE on site outdoor parking for one car and additional cars can be parked off Strongs Drive in the neighborhood (pay attention to the signs for any time restrictions). It's perfect for families, groups of friends, or business travelers. We can accommodate up to 8 people (4 downstairs and 4 upstairs). The location is within a 15-minute drive from LAX and costs around $24 plus tip via Taix and often less with Uber/LYFT. You can also use Prime Time Shuttle for a shared ride. Dogs considered for an additional fee of $100; generally we do not allow cats. Additional Amenities: Smart 40” Flat-screen TV with Cable High Speed Internet &amp; Wi-Fi Full Kitchen &amp; Appliances (microwave, coffee maker, juicer, etc.) Walk-In Closet Shower in Both Bathrooms Washer/Dryer on Premises Large Backyard with Seating and BBQ Family/Kid Friendly
                        </div>
                        <div data-reactid="1739">
                         Our neighborhood is right on the boarder of Venice Beach and Marina Del Rey, just south of the Venice Pier. It’s a quiet location in a friendly beach community. A walkers paradise, you’ll be steps away from many great restaurants, coffee shops, bars, and activities. There are several great local markets off Washington Blvd. where you can walk to and get groceries, too. You are a few minute walk away from the expansive white sand beaches of Venice and Marina Del Rey Beach, where you can spend the day enjoying the sand and sun and experiencing the shopping and people watching. To the left of the Venice Pier is what neighbors call, "secret beach", a huge stretch of the quiet, powder sand beach of Marina Del Rey's Peninsula. Sit in the sun or walk north of the Venice Pier and you will come upon the famous Venice Beach Boardwalk with shops, artists, street performers, beach bars, beach restaurants and of course, more beach. Continue on your walk or bike ride and you next reach Santa Monica, then Malibu. All easily explored on bike. You can also take a relaxing stroll or bike ride along the Venice Grand Canal-- just steps from our building-- and continue to the quiet smaller canals by Dell Street. You will think you are in Venice Italy. DO NOT MISS. Another can’t miss that’s within walking distance is Abbot Kinney Blvd—a trendy block of restaurants, shops, and bars that was recently named “the coolest street in America” by GQ magazine. There’s a farmers marker there every Saturday, several local clothing companies with unique California style, the TOMS Shoes flagship store and coffee shop, several organic/vegan/vegetarian eateries, and many fine wine establishments. Santa Monica is just a 5 minute drive from the apartment, and keep going north and you hit Malibu in under 20 minutes. TOP "MUST SEE" --The Venice Murals &amp; "Art Walls" --The Venice Canals &amp; homes along the canals. --The view of Los Angeles from the "High Lounge" --Architecture --Victorian to contemporary. --Art galleries, shops, cafes, restaurants along the Boardwalk, Abbot Kinney Blvd. and Main Street. ACTIVITIES in VENICE: Sailing, para-sailing, kite flying, paddle tennis, hiking, and bicycling with beautiful ocean &amp; mountain views along the way. Bicycle, surfboard, &amp; roller skate or roller blade rentals MORE THINGS TO DO: The famous outdoor MUSCLE BEACH GYM Volley ball courts on the sand. Skateboard Park Roller Skating &amp;/ Roller Blading Park Surfing Santa Monica Pier Hiking in Malibu and Santa Monica Bike Path: 35 miles of bike path from Malibu to Hermosa Beach The Getty Museum &amp; the Getty Villa (wonderful views)
                        </div>

                          <path d="M23.993 2.75c-.296 0-.597.017-.898.051-1.14.131-2.288.513-3.408 1.136-1.23.682-2.41 1.621-3.688 2.936-1.28-1.316-2.458-2.254-3.687-2.937-1.12-.622-2.268-1.004-3.41-1.135a7.955 7.955 0 0 0-.896-.051C6.123 2.75.75 4.289.75 11.128c0 7.862 12.238 16.334 14.693 17.952a1.004 1.004 0 0 0 1.113 0c2.454-1.618 14.693-10.09 14.693-17.952 0-6.84-5.374-8.378-7.256-8.378" data-reactid="2084"></path>

                      <div class="listingDescription_1woxt0o" data-reactid="2085">
                       <div data-reactid="2086">
                        <div data-reactid="2087">
                         This Venice Loft is located just off of Abbot Kinney boasts incredible features that one would expect from a traditional Industrial loft, but with the modern comforts of a newly remodelled property.
                        </div>
                        <div data-reactid="2088">
                         This stunning architectural home features an amazing space for a couple or young family in a wonderful location of Venice Beach. The property comes together with cool and authentic furnishings, artwork and features already integrated in the house. The most obvious, yet probably most dramatic characteristic of the Venice Loft is the large living room wall that opens up to the property's high ceiling, creating a wonderful indoor/outdoor experience. The bedroom is located on the upper floor of this split-level property and the queen size bed is fitted with Ralph Lauren Sheets. Guest can take advantage of the office area on the opposite end of the room to catch up on some work. If you ever feel like cooking a nice dinner without missing out on any of the action, the loft’s open space connecting the main living/dining area, make for this property the perfect entertaining house. The comfortable couch, Internet TV and a 4-person dining room table, make it easy for guests to check in and never want to leave the house! Not to mention guests have access to a wonderful deck with great views of the Venice rooftops and palm trees. The loft is locates on the south side of Abbot Kinney just minutes from all the restaurants and shops and less than a 10-minute walk to the beach. Please note that the house does not have a dishwasher, drier or washing machine. Amenities include: - Wi-Fi - Air conditioning/heating - Queen sized bed - Clean linens and towels - Shared Deck - Shared Yoga Room - 24/7 on call assistance - Private use of the basketball area - Hair Dryer - Iron &amp; Ironing Board
                        </div>
                        <div data-reactid="2089">
                         An unconventional enclave along Los Angeles' coast, Venice combines alternative values with counter-culture street credibility. A carnival atmosphere permeates throughout this beach town, emanating from its fire-breathing street performers and its spoken-word sidewalk expressionists. Venice may be over ten miles away from Downtown, but its endearingly outlandish mixture of upscale boutiques and seedy entertainment make the trek by bus or car infinitely worth it.
                        </div>
                        <div data-reactid="2090">

Would highly recommend to stay here!</p><span data-reactid="2093">Josh</span><span data-reactid="2094">2017-01-15T00:00:00Z</span></li>

                         <li data-reactid="2099"><p data-reactid="2100">The loft (which is not stand-alone, but rather in a small complex) is very nice, well decorated, in a sort of scruffy but charming area of Venice, near restaurants and shops. Very close to LAX which is great for in/out. The hosts were friendly and handled my slightly early arrival well. I was there during an extremely cold time in LA (40s at night), and the loft is difficult to sufficiently heat in a balanced way and it was not ideal for comfort. The stairs are EXTREMELY steep and would not be good for anyone with vertigo issues or is clumsy. The bed is comfortable and the shower had good water pressure. Good wifi, nice music system to which you can attach mobile device. Would be fun to be here in better, normal LA weather.</p><span data-reactid="2101">William</span><span data-reactid="2102">2015-12-23T00:00:00Z</span></li>

He also allowed us to check in early and check out late which made such a huge difference when our flight wasn't until 5pm and he was always on hand when I had any questions and responded almost instantly. This place has such a cool vibe about it. Its comfortable, spacious and in such a great location - so close to Abbot Kinney and a short drive to Whole Foods! The kitchen is well equipped as is the bathroom, with gorgeous toiletries and fluffy towels. Its such an unusual space with loads of character we will definitely recommend it to our friends and family and will be staying here again when we come back to Venice next year. We only wish we could have stayed longer as it really felt like a home from home.                       <div class="listingDescription_1woxt0o" data-reactid="2219">
                       <div data-reactid="2220">
                        <div data-reactid="2221">
                         A beautiful, bright spacious condo, private guest room with a queen bed and a newly renovated guest bath, located two blocks from iconic Venice Beach. Onsite secure parking, access to a pool and hot tub, laundry in the space and kitchen privileges.
                        </div>
                        <div data-reactid="2222">
                         High ceilings, cool ocean breezes and open concept highlight this clean and welcoming condo located two blocks from the beach. There is a very comfy queen bed in a private guest room with a beautiful newly renovated private bath and access to the deck. The deck is the perfect place for morning coffee or an evening glass of wine while watching the stunning SoCal sunset!
                        </div>
                        <div data-reactid="2223">
                         The neighborhood is brimming with activity in very close proximity. The beach, the Marina, the Venice Canals, Abbot Kinney Blvd for shopping. Washington Blvd for surf lessons, bike rentals and great restaurants are all within walking distance. Santa Monica is a 15 minute bus ride or car ride away. All of this is less than 15 minutes from the airport (LAX).
                        </div>
                        <div data-reactid="2224">

She is incredibly nice, The apartment is beautiful, very spacious, clean,... The bed is very comfortable and the private bathroom is fantastic. The appartement is in a very quiet neighborhood, the beach and the venice pier are in walking distance, close to the airport, ... Absolutely perfect.                          <li data-reactid="2233"><p data-reactid="2234">Kathleen was excellent! She is very easy to have a conversation with but won't hold you up and chat your vacation away either. She stayed up until 1am to let us in after our plane was delayed. Being a local, she offers great tips for those not from around the Venice area. There is always something to do and she even has a cheat sheet to get you started on restaurants, events, etc. her home is inviting and comfortable. Minutes walk to Venice pier and Boardwalk, the beach, the marina, Abbott Kinney, and more. Driving distance to Malibu, west Hollywood, Beverly Hills, downtown LA, Laguna beach, and more. Very quick response for all inquiries. For example, I wanted to know if she has A/C and heat even though they aren't listed in her amenities. Although she does have A/C and heat, they aren't really used since the temperature is almost always 75 with no humidity. Being near the ocean gives you a little cooler weather than in West Hollywood or other parts of the city which is a plus. Kathleen was a wonderful host, her home is in a great location, and the home itself was perfect for one or two people.                         <div data-reactid="2353">
                         Quiet,Resort style gated community near beach. Spacious and sunny with a breathtaking view and office space. My personal belongings are all aside so it's your own home ! Guests stay 1-3 months. Security 24 h., restaurant, Café, market store, gym, pools, steam room/Sauna, Salon/SPA, Jacuzzi, tennis, housekeeping, dry cleaning. Walk to beach, marina, restaurants, markets, shops and entertainment. Immediate access to bike path. Minutes to Airport, Culver City, Playa Vista, Santa Monica, FWY.
                        </div>
                        <div data-reactid="2354">
                         *Guests stay 1-3 months ; hence only 13 great reviews in 2 years. Unique Resort lifestyle : Housekeeping, Cable TV, Wifi. Spacious (995 SqF), office area, 2 large closets, multiple drawers, balcony, bright on high floor with breathtaking views !                         </div>
                        <div data-reactid="2355">
                         Located minutes from "Silicon Beach" Playa Vista, Bohemian Chic Abbot Kinney, Venice and just a bit further, Santa Monica. Landmark hotels, the Marina and its boats, beach front biking paths, the brand new amazing Playa Vista (Theater, restaurants, shops...) and the Farmers Market will surely provide all the convenience and entertainment you need !

                      <div class="listingDescription_1woxt0o" data-reactid="2482">
                       <div data-reactid="2483">
                        <div data-reactid="2484">
                         This stylish, quiet, bright and airy Venice Bungalow located only 5 blocks to the beach and 3 to Abbot Kinney features exposed wood beams, stained concrete floors, high-end appliances and fixtures. Set in a secluded 5,000 sq ft lot surrounded by tropical plants, flowers, herbs and ornaments, the huge outdoor living area features a BBQ, comfy and spacious seating area with sofa &amp; chairs, vintage '60s fireplace. WE USED TO HAVE AIRSTREAMS, NOW WE ARE JUST RENTING THE HOUSE PRIVATELY / NO SHARES.
                        </div>
                        <div data-reactid="2485">
                         The open-plan living area includes large flat screen cable TV, Blu-Ray DVD player, dining table and benches. New kitchen with Viking stove and dishwasher, blender, juicer, Nespresso cappuccino machine. Fully-stocked with everything you'll need to cook or entertain. Bathroom features hand-made wooden cabinets, twin sinks, rain shower with endless hot water. . Large bedroom includes incredibly comfortable handmade zebra wood California King size bed and has two sets of double doors out to the garden. V. high-speed internet. All linens, towels etc included. Water filtration system installed in both kitchen and shower. ------------------- Parking for one car available in the driveway and always plenty of free street parking available outside. Please contact us about rates for photo or video shoots. Look forward to meeting you and making your stay as pleasant as possible! Feel free to send any questions our way.
                        </div>
                        <div data-reactid="2486">
                         We're located in a quiet residential street in the very heart of Venice, CA (see map). A quick 5 min walk to Abbot Kinney Blvd (recently named 'the coolest street in America' - GQ). 7 min walk to the famous Venice boardwalk and beach.
                        </div>

There are several great local markets off Washington Blvd. where you can walk to and get groceries, too. \n\n\nYou are a few minute walk away from the expansive white sand beaches of Venice and Marina Del Rey Beach, where you can spend the day enjoying the sand and sun and experiencing the shopping and people watching.  \n\n\nTo the left of the Venice Pier is what neighbors call, \"secret beach\", a huge stretch of the quiet, powder sand beach of Marina Del Rey's Peninsula. Sit in the sun or walk north of the Venice Pier and you will come upon the famous Venice Beach Boardwalk with shops, artists, street performers, beach bars, beach restaurants and of course, more beach. \n\n\nContinue on your walk or bike ride and you next reach Santa Monica, then Malibu. All easily explored on bike.\n\n\nYou can also take a relaxing stroll or bike ride along the Venice Grand Canal--  just steps from our building-- and continue to the quiet smaller canals by Dell Street. You will think you are in Venice Italy. DO NOT MISS.\n\n\nAnother can’t miss that’s within walking distance is Abbot Kinney Blvd—a trendy block of restaurants, shops, and bars that was recently named “the coolest street in America” by GQ magazine. There’s a farmers marker there every Saturday, several local clothing companies with unique California style, the TOMS Shoes flagship store and coffee shop, several organic/vegan/vegetarian eateries, and many fine wine establishments. \n\n\nSanta Monica is just a 5 minute drive from the apartment, and keep going north and you hit Malibu in under 20 minutes.  \n\n\n\nTOP \"MUST SEE\"\n--The Venice Murals &amp; \"Art Walls\"\n--The Venice Canals &amp; homes along the canals.\n--The view of Los Angeles from the \"High Lounge\"\n--Architecture --Victorian to contemporary.\n--Art galleries, shops, cafes, restaurants along the Boardwalk, Abbot Kinney Blvd. and Main Street.\n\nACTIVITIES in VENICE:\n\n\nSailing, para-sailing, kite flying, paddle tennis, hiking, and bicycling with beautiful ocean &amp; mountain views along the way. You’ll be immersed in a real neighborhood of friendly beach lovers and steps away from famous and fun attractions. \n\n\nThe space is the upper unit in a 2-story house with a large and private fenced back yard that includes outdoor seating, a large outdoor sectional couch, and a grill. It’s a great spot for a BBQ, to enjoy the sun, read a book, relax, and even get work done if needed. Backyards this size are a rarity so close to the beach in Venice—this spot is a unique gem. \n\n\nThis unit includes a living room with a large fold-out couch, chairs, a work station/dining table, and 40” smart-TV (cable with over 200 channels included). The kitchen space is fully-loaded with all of the cookware/glasses/dishes, etc. that you’d need to make a meal and includes a large refrigerator, stove, sink, and toaster oven.  There's also a breakfast nook that overlooks the Venice Canals. The bedroom has a luxurious king-size bed and connects to a full bathroom with a shower/tub as well as a large walk-in closet. \n\nCable TV and strong wifi are connected both upstairs and downstairs and the signal is great outside! \n\n\nThis cottage is situated in one of the most unique and walkable areas in Los Angeles! You will enjoy bicycle and walking paths along the oceanfront with the best people-watching in the area. Stay active with the world-famous Muscle Beach, beach volleyball courts, and surfing in your own backyard. Within walking distance are health spas and yoga studios. Dine at one of the many restaurants just around the corner on Washington Blvd. or enjoy the sunset at one of the rooftop bars. You can even walk to the fabulous Abbott Kinney—just declared the coolest block in America by GQ magazine.\n\n\nYou can walk to the many beautiful boats in the marina, and you can also walk to the Venice Boardwalk—a fun and eclectic slice of local art and culture! Fisherman's Village offers a view of Marina del Rey's dominant feature, the Marina, the world's largest man-made small craft harbor with 19 marinas with capacity for 5,300 boats and is home port to approximately 6,500 boats. It is bordered on three sides by the city of Los Angeles – Pacific Palisades on the northwest, Brentwood on the north, West Los Angeles on the northeast, Mar Vista on the east, and Venice on the southeast.\n\nSanta Monica is 3 miles away. Santa Monica has three main shopping districts, Montana Avenue on the north side of the city, the Downtown District in the city's core, and Main Street on the south end of the city. Each of these districts has its own unique feel and personality. Montana Avenue is a stretch of luxury boutique stores, restaurants, and small offices that generally features more upscale shopping. The Main Street district offers an eclectic mix of clothing, restaurants, and other specialty retail. The Downtown District is the home of the Third Street Promenade, a major outdoor pedestrian-only shopping district that stretches for three blocks between Wilshire Blvd. and Broadway. Santa Monica Place, the indoor mall designed by Frank Gehry, is located at the south end of the Promenade. Palisades Park stretches out along the crumbling bluffs overlooking the Pacific and is a favorite walking area to view the ocean. Santa Monica is home to many Hollywood celebrities and executives and is a mixture of affluent single-family neighborhoods, renters, surfers, professionals, and students. \n\nPlaya Vista is 3 miles away. Playa Vista is adjoined on the northwest by Del Rey, on the north and east by Culver City, on the southeast by Westchester and on the west by Marina Del Rey. \n\nCulver City is 4 miles away. Since the 1920s, Culver City has been a significant center for motion picture and later television production, in part because it was the home of MGM Studios. It was also the headquarters for the Hughes Aircraft Company from (phone number hidden). National Public Radio West and Sony Pictures Entertainment now have headquarters in the city. The NFL Network studio is also based in Culver City.\n\nBeverly Hills is 9 miles away. Playground to the rich and famous, Beverly Hills is the home of some of California's most opulent homes, hotels and personalities. Visitors flock to 90210 to experience the allure of Hollywood, world-class shopping, fine dining and of course star-gazing. Give your credit card a real workout at top end boutiques and department stores on Rodeo Drive and Wilshire Boulevard, or dine in famous celebrity hangouts and watch for your favorite stars. \n\nThe Getty Museum is 11 miles away, and is an art museum in California housed on two campuses: the Getty Center and Getty Villa. \n\nThe Getty Center is in the Brentwood neighborhood and is the primary location of the Museum. The collection features Western art from the Middle Ages to the present. The Museum's second location, the Getty Villa, is in the Pacific Palisades neighborhood and displays art from \"ancient Greece, Rome, and Etruria\". \n\nThe Getty Malibu is 8 miles away. \n\nHermosa Beach is 12 miles away. Hermosa Beach pier is at the end of Pier Avenue, which is one of the beach community's main shopping, eating and partying areas. \n\nManhattan Beach is 10 miles away. Manhattan Beach is a hotspot for beach volleyball and surfing. Every August, the city hosts the Manhattan Beach Open Volleyball tournament and the International Surf Festival. Manhattan Beach has attracted professional athletes and actors to take up residence there since the 1990s. \n\nLong Beach is 27 miles away. Long Beach is where the action begins and the fun never ends. From the regal Queen Mary and spectacular Aquarium of the Pacific to stirring Broadway shows, live music venues and hundreds of exclusive dining destinations--all centrally located. Airport-close, a brief and pleasant cruise away from Catalina Island. The city is a dominant maritime center of the United States. The Port of Long Beach is the United States' second busiest container port and one of the world's largest shipping ports. \nCatalina Island is a boat ride away and 22 miles across the sea. Catalina Island features fabulous land and water activities - including the new Zip Line and SeaTrek Undersea Adventure, romantic lodging for every taste and budget, a diversity of dining experiences, and extraordinary venues for weddings and group events. \n\nStaples Center is 15 miles away. Staples Center is a large multi-purpose sports arena in Downtown Los Angeles. Adjacent to the L.A. Live development, it is located next to the Los Angeles Convention Center complex along Figueroa Street. Opening on Octob(PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN), it is one of the major sporting facilities in the Greater Los Angeles Area. The arena is home to the Los Angeles Lakers and the Los Angeles Clippers of the National Basketball Association (NBA), the Los Angeles Kings of the National Hockey League (NHL), and the Los Angeles Sparks of the Women's National Basketball Association (WNBA). The Los Angeles Avengers of the Arena Football League (AFL) and the Los Angeles D-Fenders of the NBA D-League were also tenants until both franchises were discontinued; the D-Fenders moved to the Lakers' practice facility at the Toyota Sports Center in El Segundo, California for the 2011–12 season. Staples Center is also host to over 250 events and nearly (phone number hidden) guests a year. It is the only arena in the NBA shared by two teams. \n\nIt is a 11 mile drive to La Brea Tar Pits. The La Brea Tar Pits (or Rancho La Brea Tar Pits) are a group of tar pits around which Hancock Park was formed, in urban Los Angeles. Natural asphalt (also called asphaltum, bitumen, pitch or tar - brea in Spanish) has seeped up from the ground in this area for tens of thousands of years. The tar is often covered with dust, leaves, or water. Over many centuries, the bones of animals that were trapped in the tar were preserved. The George C. Page Museum is dedicated to researching the tar pits and displaying specimens from the animals that died there. The La Brea Tar Pits are a registered National Natural Landmark. \n\nThe California Science Center is 12 miles away and houses the Space Shuttle Endeavor.\n \nHollywood is 12 miles away. It is prominent for its place as the home of the entertainment industry, including several of its historic studios. Its name has come to represent the motion picture industry of the United States. Street limits of the Hollywood neighborhood are: north, Hollywood Boulevard from La Brea Avenue to the east boundary of Wattles Garden Park and Franklin Avenue between Bonita and Western avenues; east, Western Avenue; south, Melrose Avenue, and west, La Brea Avenue or the West Hollywood city line. Also, Hollywood is home to the famous \nAnaheim, the home to TCL Chinese Theatre is a cinema on the historic Hollywood Walk of Fame at 6925 Hollywood Boulevard in Hollywood, California. Originally Grauman's Chinese Theatre. \n\nIt is 15 miles to Sherman Oaks. Sherman Oaks is a neighborhood in the San Fernando Valley. A number of celebrities live in Sherman Oaks. There is many shops, restaurants and movie theaters along the main street Ventura Blvd. \nStudio City is 19 miles away. Studio City is a historic neighborhood within the city of Los Angeles, California, in the San Fernando Valley, known for the number of celebrities who have been seen or who reside there. Studio City is bordered on the north by Valley Village, on the east by Toluca Lake and Universal City, on the south by Hollywood Hills West, on the southwest by Beverly Crest and on the west by Sherman Oaks. \n\nGriffith Observatory is a 20 mile drive. Griffith Observatory is a facility sitting on the south-facing slope of Mount Hollywood in Los Angeles' Griffith Park. It commands a view of the Los Angeles Basin, including Downtown Los Angeles to the southeast, Hollywood to the south, and the Pacific Ocean to the southwest. The observatory is a popular tourist attraction with an extensive array of space and science-related displays. \n\nPalos Verdes is 22 miles away. Palos Verdes is home to Terranea Resort, which offers spectacular views of the Pacific. Terrenea is a great place to grab a cocktail at sunset or have a casual dinner outside at Nelson’s. \n\nAnaheim, the home of Disneyland and Downtown Disney, is 40 miles away. Downtown Disney (officially the Downtown Disney District) is an outdoor shopping, dining, and entertainment area, also known as a \"shoppertainment center\", located at the Disneyland Resort in Anaheim, California, United States. It was constructed during the Disneyland Resort expansion which also included the construction of Disney California Adventure, and opened on January 12, 2001.\n \nThe Nixon Presidential Library is 49 miles away. The Richard Nixon Presidential Library and Museum is the presidential library and final resting place of Richard Milhous Nixon, the 37th President of the United States. Located in Yorba Linda, California, the library is one of thirteen administered by the National Archives and Records Administration. From its original dedication in 1990 until becoming a federal facility on July 11, 2007, the library and museum was operated by the private Richard Nixon Foundation and was known as the Richard Nixon Library &amp; Birthplace. The 9-acre (3.6 ha) campus is located at 18001 Yorba Linda Boulevard in Yorba Linda, California and incorporates the National Historic Landmarked Richard Nixon Birthplace where Nixon was born in 1913 and spent his childhood. The facility is now jointly operated by NARA and the Richard Nixon Foundation. \n\nThe Reagan Presidential Library is 45 miles away. The Ronald Reagan Presidential Library and Center for Public Affairs is the presidential library and final resting place of Ronald Wilson Reagan, the 40th President of the United States. Designed by Hugh Stubbins and Associates, the library is located in Simi Valley. The library may be accessed by driving to the Olsen Road exit of State Route 23, which connects to the nearby Ronald Reagan Freeway, State Route 118. The Reagan Library is the largest of the thirteen federally operated presidential libraries. The street address, 40 Presidential Drive, is numbered in honor of Reagan's place as the 40th President. The Reagan Library is open daily from 10am - 5pm, with the exception of a few holidays (Thanksgiving Day, Christmas Day and New Year's Day). Parking is free, as is access to the grounds surrounding the library, but there is an admission fee for entry into the library and special exhibits. \n\nOjai is a beautiful community 81 miles north. The town is known mostly for its hotels and services catering to tourism, recreation including strong hiking, and spiritual retreats, as well as for a strong farmers' market on Sundays and an abundance of local organic agriculture. It also has an abundance of small businesses specializing in local and ecologically friendly art, design, and home improvement—such as galleries and a solar power company—as chain stores (other than a few gas stations) are forbidden by Ojai city law to encourage local small business development and keep the town unique. The city's self-styled nickname is \"The Shangri-La of Southern California\", referring to the similarities between the health-and-spirituality-focused region and the mystical sanctuary of James Hilton's novel Lost Horizon. \n\nSanta Barbara is 94 miles away. Santa Barbara's climate is often described as Mediterranean, and the city has been promoted as the \"American Riviera\". \n\nThe San Diego Zoo Safari Park is 120 miles away. The San Diego Zoo Safari Park, known as the San Diego Wild Animal Park until 2010, is an 1,800 acre zoo in the San Pasqual Valley area of San Diego, California, near Escondido. \n\nIt is one of the largest tourist attractions in San Diego County LEGOLAND is 102 miles away. LEGOLAND California Resort features more than 60 rides, shows and attraction. \n\nSan Diego is 130 miles away. \nTourism is a major industry owing to the city's climate, its beaches, and numerous tourist attractions such as Balboa Park, Belmont amusement park, San Diego Zoo, San Diego Zoo Safari Park, and SeaWorld San Diego. San Diego's Spanish and Mexican heritage is reflected in the many historic sites across the city, such as Mission San Diego de Alcala and Old Town San Diego State Historic Park. Annual events in San Diego include Comic-Con, the Farmers Insurance Open golf tournament, San Diego Pride, the San Diego Black Film Festival, and Street Scene Music Festival. It’s a quiet location in a friendly beach community. A walkers paradise, you’ll be steps away from many great restaurants, coffee shops, bars, and activities. There are several great local markets off Washington Blvd. where you can walk to and get groceries, too. \n\n\nYou are a few minute walk away from the expansive white sand beaches of Venice and Marina Del Rey Beach, where you can spend the day enjoying the sand and sun and experiencing the shopping and people watching.  \n\n\nTo the left of the Venice Pier is what neighbors call, \"secret beach\", a huge stretch of the quiet, powder sand beach of Marina Del Rey's Peninsula. Sit in the sun or walk north of the Venice Pier and you will come upon the famous Venice Beach Boardwalk with shops, artists, street performers, beach bars, beach restaurants and of course, more beach. \n\n\nContinue on your walk or bike ride and you next reach Santa Monica, then Malibu. All easily explored on bike.\n\n\nYou can also take a relaxing stroll or bike ride along the Venice Grand Canal--  just steps from our building-- and continue to the quiet smaller canals by Dell Street.
